“Rodya, Rodya! It’s the same as yesterday,” Pulcheria cried. 

“Why call yourself a scoundrel?” 

“Brother,” Dounia said firmly, “there’s a mistake. I’m marrying for myself.” 

“Lying,” he thought, biting his nails. “Proud creature! She won’t admit charity.” 

“I choose the lesser evil,” Dounia continued. “I won’t deceive him.” 

“Why did you smile?” 

“Why are you laughing?” 

“Are you lying, sister?” he grinned maliciously.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia asserts that she is marrying for her own sake rather than out of sacrifice or charity, despite her brother's accusations.
